| ---- | --------- |
| ACK | [Sjors](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/28863#pullrequestreview-1786351038), [TheCharlatan](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/28863#pullrequestreview-1786371835), [glozow](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/28863#issuecomment-1860046724) |
| Stale ACK | [BrandonOdiwuor](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/28863#pullrequestreview-1748377227) |

If your review is incorrectly listed, please react with ð to this comment and the bot will ignore it on the next update.
<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#29086](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/29086) (refactor: Simply include CTxMemPool::Options in CTxMemPool directly rather than duplicating definition by luke-jr)
* [#28676](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/28676) ([WIP] Cluster mempool implementation by sdaftuar)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.
nit: I don't think adding this variable improves readability
diff_hunk:
@@ -612,10 +612,11 @@ def run_test(self):
         # So we should be able to generate exactly chainlimit txs for each original output
         sending_addr = self.nodes[1].getnewaddress()
         txid_list = []
-        for _ in range(chainlimit * 2):
+        chain_limit_2x = 2 * chainlimit

body: Thanks Fixed
diff_hunk:
@@ -612,10 +612,11 @@ def run_test(self):
         # So we should be able to generate exactly chainlimit txs for each original output
         sending_addr = self.nodes[1].getnewaddress()
         txid_list = []
-        for _ in range(chainlimit * 2):
+        chain_limit_2x = 2 * chainlimit

body:
> It would be nice if the test can reach all four possible limit error messages, but if that's difficult to achieve it could wait for a followup.

Previously we always got the `Transaction has too long of a mempool chain` message but with this PR we now get the node unconfirmed parents limit.
[checkChainLimits](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/5800c558eb5efb4839ed00d6967e43306d68e1c3/src/node/interfaces.cpp#L703) is sending a package with one Internally created transaction and its `vsize` as the package `vsize`, package count will always be one.
Nit: I believe this addition might be unnecessary, considering that other instances of `std::string` in the file seem to work fine without it
According to iwyu, it seems better to include

Note that with cluster mempool #28676 the error would change. Which is another reason why I think it's useful to have tests cases for all four scenario's. But it can wait for another PR, and perhaps @sdaftuar could write it :-)

Thanks @Sjors 
I Would also like to work on it whenever that happens.

Not blocking.
Could return `util::Result<void>` and inline all the `err_string` return messages within the `CheckPackageLimits` function.
Thanks  @furszy updated to your suggestion, its more elegant, and no need for out parameter `err_string`

Thanks for review @TheCharlatan @furszy 

- Addressed @furszy comment
- Forced pushed bd5417e47cd2452817d7de859839b63210233a5c to 28115d81b2 [Compare diff](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/compare/bd5417e47cd2452817d7de859839b63210233a5c..28115d81b2eacb15dd4835d5536a71b0b5ac835b)
Since we're now changing interfaces, I think `CheckPackageLimits` could return a `Result` type too.

Taken in https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/28863/commits/e572a530d224214121371c9e42a013ef3b26ee0e
Thanks

Force pushed from https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/commit/28115d81b2eacb15dd4835d5536a71b0b5ac835b to https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/commit/e572a530d224214121371c9e42a013ef3b26ee0e 
[Compare diff](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/compare/28115d81b2eacb15dd4835d5536a71b0b5ac835b..e572a530d224214121371c9e42a013ef3b26ee0e)
* Updated the PR OP and title
* Addressed @TheCharlatan comment https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/28863#discussion_r1404640801
Just a comment: Would be nice to get #25665 merged, so we can get a move constructor here.
Thanks @TheCharlatan that can come as a follow-up post https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/25665 I think?
